bow: having second child feels right never want to make general statements for anyone else experience my toddler will be two in few months and just had baby number two and so far couldn be happier it only day at home this is for anyone who has been thinking about having second one baby number was long labor through the night with an epidural and pitocin after two hours of pushing and using forceps had third degree tear recovery was terrible for at least weeks plus had no idea what to do with newborn the first few months were tough due to recovery learning and nursing nobody told me nursing could be so challenging cut to baby number she stayed in weeks longer woke at 6:30am to my water being gently broken checked into the hospital at 8:05am and delivered at 9:40am things progressed so quickly that had to stop pushing until my doctor could make it back even though that last hour was miserable since had no meds in my system felt euphoric as soon as she came out only had 1st degree tear was up and showered within the first hours always already talking to her nursing her and ready for the rest of the day just instantly fell in love with baby because finally knew what to do with baby my first is my best buddy but now don have to worry about how to hold baby how to nurse baby and don have to stress about everything she does just get to skip straight to loving her kind of glad to have the distraction of my first to tell myself it ok to set her down and rest your brain while you play with baby *knowing baby still has needs helps me to feel needed as mom more than just survivor of newborn thank you for reading thanks for sharing this and glad you are having good experience so far am expecting my second in nov and it reassuring to read this positive post im about to have baby and your second labor sounds wonderful my first labor was almost days total and it was not fun thankfully where live we get nurse to help out at home during the first week so that helps with learning all of the new stuff but do remember being mentally exhausted from all the newness this time definitely already feel more relaxed going into it now just hope my labor is lot easier than with the first wow this sounds exactly like me is almost weeks and my experience is similar there were some tough moments with the toddler adjusting but already feel like she is starting to love her sibling thank you for sharing am expecting my second in jan and my toddler is 22 months everyone tells me it will be super difficult with but feel so much more hopeful after reading this loved reading this 32 weeks with my second another daughter hoping for totally different labor and delivery this time as am not high risk like was with my first had to be induced at 38 with her then emergency section after laboring all day also can wait to nurse newborn now that know what to do nursing my first was hell for about months she just weaned few months ago so while am grateful for the break am looking forward to newborn cuddles congratulations are your new addition gt just instantly fell in love with baby because finally knew what to do with baby so much this everything about the second baby just felt natural even with very strong case of ppd having another child was great decision for us now he and it so fun to see him and his brother interact and he \*so different\* from his older brother it completely different baby with different milestones and likes and dislikes and personality congrats mama friend of mine with said it gets easier when they are old enough to entertain each other looking forward to that thank you for sharing due with baby number in oct and hope to have the same experience thank you for posting this am due in december with baby and have been super stressed about it this has helped ease some of my worry yes this is great my daughter has been bugging me for little sister or brother for years we finally have our second on the way might go for whenever hear people say they only want one do say anything out loud because it their decision and none of my business but feel so bad no one wants to be an only child its nice to have siblings to fall back on when parents are out of the picture as well thanks for sharing this is exactly what needed to hear my birth experience was terrible for my first like you long labour forceps assisted delivery along with an episiotomy could barely walk out of the hospital when they discharged me along with the pain of breastfeeding and dealing with engorged boobs and not know what the heck to do with newborn did feel back to normal until months after do want second one but just do want to go through that all over again so it refreshing to hear stories that for some it easier the second time around please tell me do you go through the nursing pain again with your second or have they permanently calloused over that it gets easier thank you very well put never wanted kids growing up let alone two felt the same since our 2nd lo was born months ago the learning is mostly over and you get to enjoy 1st lo is toddler and is such an amazing helper she is my first love and will have bond with her that will be special because we learned together seeing those together makes life finally click so lucky to have had these two beautiful souls was amazing but is godsend just had baby seven weeks ago and whole heartily agree it is night and day easier and so happy thanks for posting pregnant with my second 19w and my first just turned 13 months and just scared the first time was so hard so it nice to read something like this thanks for sharing this is actually really helpful this is exactly what needed to read this morning 36 weeks pregnant with and is 23 months and the panic of how going to do this is really setting in lol yes just had my second few months ago and this is so accurate feel the same way this is really awesome pov had thought about what it would be like to have baby and feel like you know what you re doing lol must be nice little tender so far but my milk came in faster she cluster fed the first two days but few things my lactation consultant said last time keeps sounding through my ears an awake baby is hungry baby if the latch hurts it ok to break the seal and try again the football hold works great with newborn and has helped disperse the friction plus now know how to correct lip and tongue ties thrush remedies etc knowledge is power lol you can do it needed to hear this thank you for sharing agree completely have second one if you want to enjoy having newborn thank you for sharing my first birth experience was so similar to yours pushing for almost three hours episiotomy forceps third degree while it was lot dilated quickly and hoping the second time around is lot easier on my body with better recovery 27 weeks along now and your story gives me lot of hope that fantastic it went lot like that for me as well with the knowing better what to do part it helped thatmy second loved to sleep whereas my first acted as if he was allergic to sleeping 😂😭 hope you keep having good days mama congrats tha you so much expecting in december andy 1st will be about one and half was overcome with depression anxiety through my first trimester because justfelt so unprepared can barely take care of one happy monster let alone one and an extremely needy fresh nugget but as the months progress and my 1st gets little older and becomes bot more independent feel like its going to be ok both were welcome but unexpected suprises your post gives me confidence going to be fine this is so reassuring expecting number in dec with year old at home and worried about the transition my girls are currently weeks and almost 20 months was scared at first having two close in age but it the best months pregnant with baby number and this is what needed to hear so scared of how going to juggle both of them that often forget about all these sweet happy baby moments thank you this is sweet congrats and enjoy due with my second any day so this is reassuring thank you for sharing this have 22 month old and week old and you put to words some of the things ve been feeling just to share the other side if having one child feels right oneanddone can have more for medical reasons but we are still very happy with our only thank you for sharing ve loved watching my first grow and learn he so sweet and silly thank you for sharing this we are about to start trying for baby again and still feeling apprehensive the first go was really rough for me and it nice to hear these sorts of stories my third is weeks old toddler is now 22 months was terrified as the age gap between my first is years and this baby was planned but honestly its been breeze sure there will be plenty of challenges ahead but actually really enjoying it make sure you ve got some help on hand for the first week back home but bet you ll be fine gt thankfully where live we get nurse to help out at home during the first week where is this magical place momma needed to read this today thank you thank you thank you this has spoken straight through the fears and insecurities have about my baby girl who is set to join our little trio any day or hour now your experience has me even more excited for her arrival ❤️ my girls are 15 months apart 30 months and 15 months old totally agree on many of your sentiments was unicorn pregnancy and birth compared to the complications before during and after birth with knowing what and how to do things as well as having all necessary supplies is definitely leg up that said really hope it stays magical not the entirity of our days are magical but there magical moment in all of them this far in they are starting to play it so sweet to see them interacting could imagine having huge gap between them what beautiful sentiments my daughter is and very attached to me and due in february your words made me even more excited to bond with both kids the netherlands my year old daughter is an only child have never desired to have more than one my child is loving very social and close to us and her grandparents she lights every room she enters feel that won the lottery with her and never want to change our family dynamic my husband is on the same page most of our friends only have one child couple have none there are no guarantees that siblings will be your best friends or heck even be there when you need them during crisis or after your parents are gone have personally experienced this and know many others like myself my husband is only child btw and has fully enjoyed his childhood experience and to this day is closer to his parents than am to mine know you say say nothing out loud but your post reeks of judgement there was absolutely no need to turn this post into pity party for the side that thinks different from you so sweet to read this am one and done but can imagine the relief of already being an experienced mom with new baby so glad to hear you ve found nice place and are enjoying it you got this of course live in the us so not quite the same support system my first is almost months and ve always imagined having or kids but these have been the hardest months of my life and practically taking care of him alone nursing was such major challenge and finally after months finally feel settled into nursing though my supply still does meet his demand it has been such rollercoaster with big dips going deep underground and ve been so afraid at even the thought of second child the idea of having to care for toddler plus newborn seems impossible and so draining had an easy pregnancy and 11 hours in labor with pushing but that is what scared of thanks for sharing this it makes me feel little bit more relaxed at the idea this has been really encouraging to me as someone who also had 3rd degree tear recovery was so horrific still recovering and the thought of getting another one is terrifying it good that there is hope of only first degree tear thank you thank you thank you for sharing this have toddler and really want to get pregnant with baby get scared of how can equally love babies or how it ll be like to go through the newborn stage all over again but you gave me so much comfort you rock mama it like fricken night and day nothing more than swollen and tender this time still have stitches but they re all internal even had smooth first bowel movement lol thank you for sharing this pregnant with my second made me tear up also 100 of hospital delivery is covered for everyone when it comes to health care do love my country get through the first year before trying then your toddler will have more months to grow up before you bring baby into the world at months you re just now getting into the really fun times it really got so much better for us after we finished nursing at months and could just enjoy watching him grow it gets better aww you re sweet it so fun to see my toddler light up at the sight of his new baby it going to be fun to teach baby to help and love on baby think just being mindful to include is one of the most important factors in bonding yes we wanted ours within two years at this point baby will never remember life without his new sibling praying they continue to get along agree just had my second and in so much more comfortable omg 37 weeks with and have year old and this is making me too emotional this is what ve been hoping it would be like to bring home baby brother 😭😭 that amazing happy for you ready if ever need to take another post birth dump glycerin suppositories 👌👌 thank you for sharing just had baby about weeks ago and feel exactly the same way this was almost exactly my experience also it also felt more than twice as hard those first three four months but slowly it gets easier then harder then easier again two years with two in tow and can safely saw that while just having one was about 000 times easier seeing the two of them play together happily is literally my favorite thing in the world jumping on the bandwagon of needed to hear this too first dd is and due with in about month my girl is so so time feel 100 ready at this point in my life older and less insecure than was when had my son got chance to go to college and personally grow just so excited for all of what to come with baby thank you for posting this my daughter is months old and would really like to go ahead and get pregnant when she about but sometimes worry ll be ruining my special relationship with her by having another one so soon do relish the thought that will really know what doing next time around really needed to read this im weeks with baby baby will be months shy of two at my due date and have so many worries but you doing so well gives me reassurance that maybe it wo be as hard as imagining my husband wants baby and not against it but just cant wrap my head around loving another baby as much as do my 1st one how is it possible for my heart to grow bigger for more love for another child know that sounds crazy but an only child so dont have experience with siblings on one hand want like kids but on the other how do split my time between them all this post and comments is reassuring totally have tips wrote this post while was in the thick of it https www reddit com babybumps comments 95zxch to all you soon to be second time momsespecially utm medium=android app amp utm source=share also other than the post linked if you can have someone keep the eldest while you settle in and bond with new baby do it the biggest favor did myself was sending the eldest to her grandma for days from the day before delivery was being induced so it was easier by the time she came back had established nursing my milk was in and was settled in it totally overwhelming at times wo lie we had few family cry sessions on hard days just know sitting them somewhere safe and separated and walking away for few to gather yourself is totally okay you have good transition team from the sound of it good luck and welcome to the next chapter of the adventure thanks unfortunately our family is halfway across the country thanks military but we will do our best my fam is pretty far too from the sounds of it though with both husband and mama being there your transition should be smooth didnt have anyone when we came home husband went back to work before bebe and were released from the hospital mil drove hrs each way to pick up and drop off the eldest we were lucky sounds like you have good team good luck for real dont worry about the eldest mine adjusted pretty well think the worst part of it was not being able to cat nap with the baby you have to be on for the oldest but it is nice bonding time most times when laid the baby down cuddled and played with the toddler it tough to juggle but you ll get through it this many months in it starting to be fun and manageable say by the time they are itll be downright awesome oh man yeah really dreading not sleeping the most remember what it was like especially the first couple weeks and my daughter only recently started sleeping through the night so scared haha she was particularly difficult still is she clingy mess but happier so hoping that he easier not that any babies are easy but easier in comparison to her was about to add make sure the eldest is good and sleep trained out of your bedroom would have survived otherwise fingers crossed for you my kids are total opposites it amazing how much personality babies have
